title: Would you play a League tabletop RPG?
body: So with this new resurgence of Lore riot is pumping out i think they should look into making a Table Top RPG based on leagues lore, the game could feature cool and unique classes, you probably wouldn't play as champs but who knows, i think it would be so awesome and i would defiantly love to see it one day and I'm sure a lot of the League community would enjoy it.

replies.body: Play it? Hell, if someone could cover the art department, I'd build the fucking thing.

I would love to try and build a game like this, so much would fit perfectly but my biggest concern was leagues unfinished inconsistent current lore, however just a game set in runeterra or valoran would be enough for me with its cool world and creation lore.
If you can cover the art, again, I can totally make this. It would take a while, but this is absolutely within my realm of expertise.
If you actually wanna try and make a League Home-brew hit me up on discord (IDÓ¨X#8543), if its free anyway we can use existing league art or i can get my friend to help.

I think the main developers, who have recently left their positions, wanted develop this type of game.
I find it would be cool. All champions could be just bosses or other NPC. And we have different fractions to play for (Demacia, Noxus, Blidgewater e.t.c).
But I would only be interested in such (and any MMORPG)  if it would have reasonable F2P, cheap price, and good PvP.

Tabletop RPGs was what nerdy people played before RPG videogames existed. Many still play them.

Dungeons and Dragons/Pathfinder is the most popular.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tabletop_role-playing_game

Ah I think I am getting it.
I remember I played Monopoly when I was a kid, but basically, that's all my experience with tabletop RPG games, if you can even call it (Monopoly) RPG.

Tabletop RPG's are like story based game you play with dice that decide the success of actions, the game master weaves a story around the players as they go along and narrates the story the players are in. Players have essentially ultimate freedom to do whatever they choose and many different systems have different quirks like D&D being a Mage + Knight kind of design while Eclipse Phase is a futuristic sci-fy game
